meanings.definition: The act of regressing or going back
meanings.sent1: After the accident, the patient showed signs of regression in his recovery.
meanings.sent2: The regression of the economy led to job losses for many people.
meanings.sent3: The regression of technology in the movie made it seem like a blast from the past.
meanings.sent4: Her regression to childhood habits under stress surprised her friends.
meanings.sent5: The regression of the city into chaos was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A return to a former or less developed state
meanings.sent1: The regression of the forest to its natural state was a welcome sight.
meanings.sent2: His regression to old habits worried his family.
meanings.sent3: The regression of the clock to an earlier time confused everyone.
meanings.sent4: The regression of the building to its original design pleased the architect.
meanings.sent5: The regression of the river to its meandering path was a beautiful transformation.

meanings.definition: A statistical technique used to analyze the relationship between variables
meanings.sent1: The regression analysis showed a strong correlation between the two factors.
meanings.sent2: She used regression to predict future trends in the stock market.
meanings.sent3: The regression of data points on the graph made it easier to understand.
meanings.sent4: The regression model helped in forecasting sales for the upcoming quarter.
meanings.sent5: The regression line on the scatter plot highlighted the trend perfectly.
